Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Suzewebb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palazzo for 3 nights. Lovely spacious luxurious rooms, excellent location, helpful staff and fantastic views from roof top restaurant (where breakfast is served). Would of given it 5/5 if not for the noise of car horns in the early hours of Saturday morning. If this hotel invested in double glazing it would be perfect! Needless to say, we had a fantastic short break - thank you Palazzo Donizetti.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star service without pretension”
Reviews.Author: DrAndyman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a two-week vacation through Europe and the Middle East that included an extended stay in Istanbul. We stayed at a number of places during the trip, but none measured up to The Palazzo Donizetti in terms of service, value, location, and amenities. I could go on about the ways that this hotel distinguished itself from others-- for instance, the small on-site spa is a very nice perk-- but it really was the staff that made our stay so enjoyable. From the moment we first walked through the door we were greeted with friendly smiles and hearty welcomes. Despite not having a reservation, we were treated like welcome guests. During our stay, the staff expressed a genuine interest in making sure that our time in Istanbul was a pleasant as possible. No detail was spared. From the bell captain who asked us every day about our most recent exploits to the doorman who secured for us only the most trusted taxi drivers. If you are going to Istanbul, you should stay at Palazzo Donizetti. Unlike the sleepy confines of Sultanahmet where good restaurants and bars are tough to find after dark, the neighborhood around this hotel is alive until the wee hours of the morning. And yet it is close enough to the major tourist attractions (e.g. Ayasofya, the Spice Bazaar, etc...) that you could get to them in a matter of minutes. And, it is luxurious enough that you will get a good night's rest before traipsing back out into the busy streets of Istanbul. In short, the Palazzo Donizetti should be your first and last choice when looking for a place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: sselhorst
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have always preferred to stay in different areas of the cities we travel to, and we have never in years stayed at one hotel for more than 2 days at a time. On this trip, even while we made plans to move each day to another location, we were ultimately unable to rip ourselves away from our home away from home, and ended up staying a record 7 days, knowing that we were unlikely to find anything as wonderful elsewhere. Having wandered in off the street looking for a hotel for that evening, we were offered the corner suite at what I would consider a ridiculously reasonable rate, considering the size and beauty of the room and the amenities offered. The staff were not only helpful and professional, but personable, authentically friendly and genuine in a manner that is unusual to find in the industry. The bedding and shower were both heavenly, the view spectacular and the location ideal. Also, they offer access to the their steam room and sauna at no extra charge. It was very loud, but not in a way that I would consider noisy. All of the ambient sound was that of the street and the music from the neighboring club on the weekends (the music was stellar as well), and not the noise of construction trucks or other undesirable nuisances. I am a girl who likes to sleep to the sounds of the city, however, so I would recommend an interior room to those who prefer silence at bedtime (and Istanbul never sleeps!). All in all, I miss my home away from home and all of the friendly faces that greeted me there. The Palazzo Donizetti has my highest recommendation. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of noise at weekend nights but nice view and good service”
Reviews.Author: yaredabestani
Reviews.Content: the hotel is near to shopping centers and restuarants, very clean rooms,very good service,desirable wifi,pleasant message. the staff were very nice especially front office manager,muzaffer.I would recommend this Hotel to anybody who needs a hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A little noise but great rooms”
Reviews.Author: jellyfish11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good location, close to the main shopping street and restaurants. I was shown to my room by a member of hotel staff who then explained how everything in the room worked. My room was nice with tall ceilings and there was free wifi available. I was awoken by noise coming from the street on both nights of my stay and from loud music coming from the hotel bar that lasted late into the evening and possibly past midnight. My room was several floors above the bar so I can only imagine how noisy it must have been in the room directly above the bar. Breakfast is served on the top floor of the hotel where you can sit and admire the view of the whole city. That said, the hotel is great and I would stay here again. I found a great cafe around the corner and did feel relaxed in the hotel. The staff were very polite but I was a little concerned by excess furniture being stored in the fire escape (internal stairwell) that I saw when taking the stairs from the restaurant because there was too high a demand for the small lift after breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel and First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Neill A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were excellent.My room was spotless and the wifi worked well.I would recommend this Hotel to anybody who needs to a hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful atmosphere in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Zaltka
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with an old fashion interior. They even have an old style elevator in the middle of the stairway. The breakfast was not the best I had but it was still okay. The rooms are cozy and large.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Donizetti Hotel was a little difficult to find, our taxi driver had to ask for directions, but once we arrived, we were amazed by just how friendly and helpful everyone was. The manager and porter (Ayhan) went out of their way to ensure that we were completely settled in and provided us with very helpful advice about both the hotel and the city. Both the room and the hotel were stunning. We were upgraded to one of the corner suites, which was both luxurious and comfortable at the same time. The hotel has excellent facilities, we made full use of the leisure facilities, the bar and room service, and is an excellent base for a visit to Istanbul as most of the attractions are either within walking distance or easily accessible by public transport. We would thoroughly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ritwik B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Palazzo for 7 nights and let me say I was impressed by the hotel, it was clean well mantained and to specially mention especially when you are in Turkey.....the staff at the hotel was amazing very courteous and friendly, ready to help unlike other hotels i have earlier stayed in Istanbul. Overall a nice place only if they could change their breakfast everyday as it surely becomes boring to eat the same stuff every day. Would definitely come back again. Ritwik Bhatnagar stayed at room no. 408

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Palazzo Donizetti”
Reviews.Author: Marco227
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel for 2 nights in January 2012. The hotel staff is really kind and helpful, trying to satisfy any guest's need. We were also offered early check-in (fundamental as we landed at 6.30 AM) and an upgrade to a wonderful corner room, which had a beautiful view on the city. Rooms are of excellent quality, only a bit noisy, but this is due to the windows that had to be preserved as historical fittings. Location is very good, close to many nice trendy restaurants and shops, and not far from Sultanhamet or the metro or ferry station. The hotel serves breakfast, drinks and sometimes dinner on the stunning rooftop lounge, featuring incredible views of the city. Turkish bath was lovely and professionally made. We'll definitely come back to the hotel and would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Donizetti was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Desiree R
Reviews.Content: i was there with my family around new year and it was great. All the personal was very friendly and helpfull. The hotel looked great, it looks a little bit like a historical building. The frontoffice was very nice and friendly. It's near the centre of istanbul and there are nice restaurants. Also it is easy to get from palazzo donizetti to all the historical places of istanbul. We probably go back to this fantastic hotel around may.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY! Even strees are more confortable and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Sobhioler a
Reviews.Content: Damm my worst choose ever by choosing this hotel since they ruined my vocation, i did not sleep because of lousy voice from the closed window omg even if it was closed i feel wind in the room and heard the people like they are having fun in my room, they wanted to charge extra price when i wanted to change my room, what a stupit policy, i took serious the comments and booked at this hotel but it was absolutely the worst place to stay. Breakfast is poor very poor, it was on the beautifull terrace but there was nothing to eat, very poor... what a shame, they must be proud of themself as they scruwed us, i fell myself lite a donkey falling from the grand canyon. Location is good but there are a lot of hotels in this area to be choosen instead of donizetti.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Tripwell
Reviews.Content: Luxurious rooms, beautiful furnishings, decor and great service. Spa downstairs is also great to unwind -do note it is just baths and a pool in the basement. Breakfast was full on. This was the only thing that could with improvement. Otherwise fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hangini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October with a Roads Scholar tour. I'm bothered by noise at night, and had read that street noise can be a problem, so we asked for and were given an inside room. Our room felt large, with two curtained windows opening onto the large white air shaft. It was attractive and extremely comfortable, and we were never disturbed by street noise. A few small drawers (5 or 6?) and a big closet. The rest of the hotel, particularly the lobby, was lovely, the hotel employees were extremely helpful, and we were close to some excellent restaurants and all the fun of Istiklal Street. We had a very good breakfast every morning in the hotel dining room. (Our one dinner there was not quite as good.) The massage in the hotel spa was extraordinarily good. I'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: khaledalastani
Reviews.Content: location is excellent , rooms area good enough , clean , i recomanded istanbul visotors to stay at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Desertmadam
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated (plush carpets) and great service. Also centrally located and on the metro. Istanbul can be a bit touch and when it comes to hotels, particularly in the 150 euro mark which is my corporate budget. A true little gem, back this week again! Only minor complaint was that there is some street noise, but did not affect me too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: GerardNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the "Soho"-like part of Istanbul. Very busy neighborhood, but lots of things to do. Comfortable, with a helpful, friendly staff. My room on the first floor was comfortable, but unfortunately right on the street. In this room the noise from the people and the traffic outside was terrible and seemed to last the entire night, with maybe a one hour break around 5 AM. I hardly slept both nights. My room had no view but looked out onto an old building, right across the street. The restaurant on the top floor of the hotel provides a wonderful view of Istanbul and a part of the Bosporus. It does take some patience to get there, because the elevator s very slow and small.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at Palazzo Donizetti!”
Reviews.Author: ShangLady
Reviews.Content: Evoking a bygone era, this lovingly restorred hotel has recently reopened (with all the techno-trappings demanded in today's world)., The staff members are friendly and very helpful (English is widely spoken). The location is perfect for getting out and about on foot (the evening walking street is just one block away - shops, restaurants, book stores - I was in heaven! The neighborhood of Taksim is recommended if you have an early flight; close to the main road, our trip to the airport (at rush hour) took appx 30 min. A first time visitor to Istanbul, I was delighted with my choice!

Reviews.Title: “special thanks for the best hospitality”
Reviews.Author: saniyar
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write a note to thank you again for the wonderful visit we had with you.I had a great time visiting,Thank you very much for your hospitality. As always you have my 5 star rating for your kindly hospitality,I want spacially thank MR MUZAFFER OSMANAGAOGLU too. I hope the best wishes for you

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Nice Hotel in Asmalimescit..”
Reviews.Author: Selim-imre
Reviews.Content: After my business trip from Berlin, I just wanted to stop in Istanbul and stayed in this lovely hotel. I've stayed so many hotels in Istanbul for business and leisure reasons. But this lovely hotel makes me feel more relaxed and happy. Rooms are so much convenient and you can find everything you need in the room, unlike other hotels in European Countries, it's quite big ( standard room ) and you dont feel stucked in the room. ( I had stayed in London in one chain hotel, and there was even no place to put your luggage . ) The Staff is so nice and lovely, they're polite. Also this hotel is really in the city centre, you can go anywhere easly , to the nice restaurant, bars. Downstairs, there's North Shields Bar ( that I love it so much ) and on the corner you can find another restaurant . ( Raki & Fish ) The Breakfast Buffet was so nice, you can see there are various cheeses, fruits ( that you cant find it in London, or in Berlin.. This time at Steigenberger couldnt find any kind of cheese ). I had a great weekend with my mom and hope to coming soon to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: zeynepsan
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this hotel first of all of because of its location and secondly for its very romantic historic name ( Donizetti was an Italian composer who worked for the Ottoman Sultan). Going back to my review re hotel, it has everything I expected from such a boutique hotel, its in a unique old building with high ceilings and beautiful furniture recently been renovated. Friendly staff and its surrounded with great restaurants with exquisite Turkish food. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was one of the best places I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: EsraErsan
Reviews.Content: In the centre of the city, they welcomes you with their classy and gentle surrounding. The nostalgic design makes you feel like you are in a europian city and also takes you years away back. My friend and I stayed 3 nights here and everything was so marvellous. The stuff was so friendly and our room was well designed, bright and comfortable.The hotel takes place one of the most popular areas in the city. You may have so many expectations from hotels. If you are looking for good service, clean room and great location, I can actually recommend Palazzo Donizetti.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay at palazzo donizetti”
Reviews.Author: johnywalker79
Reviews.Content: I booked holiday and got to spend the last week of 2010. However, I had a lot of trouble. The hotel's all cracked walls. Standard rooms are very stuffy and it smells very bad. There is no tea and coffee set-up,no pillow menu in the rooms . Lobby was very nice and very beautiful classical musics are playing but that's all. There are many other hotels in Istanbul to stay. There are two restaurants, but both very bad. Definitely i will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: squirrel84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights as part of a 6 night holiday in Istanbul. The hotel is conveniently located in the 'new part' of istanbul- for those that do not know, there are 2 sides to the city- the asian side and the european side, the new part of the city and the old part . The hotel is very near a large cosmopolitan shopping boulevard which has all the big designer label shops, fashion stores, shoe stores and expensive cafes and is in quite an expensive part of the city- great if 1. you like shopping in all the usual shops no matter what country you are in and 2. you have a few quid with you! We were aware that the hotel had just opened. Our room was nice though my boyfriend who had made the booking via an online agent was un-sure of whether we were allocated the correct type of room. Our room was not very big and located at the side of the building so had no view and overlooked a narrow side street. The shower in the bathroom was on its way to falling out of the ceiling! the hotel was lovely looking though appeared to show evidence of some cheap builders work! The lift stopped working on several occasions with us in it! it basically stops and you stand there in darkness for about 10 seconds and then it starts again. The receptionist gave us some reason for it why it does that.....though this is not really acceptable if you are not as easy going as we are and are paying alot more money to stay there! The hotel is still un-finished and I am sure will have a lovely roof terrace and other facilities when it is finished. The breakfast is good though the hotel was very quiet and there were 3-4 staff working on the breakfast shifts. on the second morning I felt quite uncomfortable as we were only 2 of 3 guests eating breakfast and the staff just kept pacing up and down, up and down, the restaurant, trying to look attentive, though clearly had nothing to do as there were only 3 guests eating and the staff were actually just quite annoying! i would have liked to have eaten my breakfast without the continuous passing of the waiter next to our table, who was just walking past, looking out of the window, and then walking back, and then again. I have worked in the hotel industry for the past 9 years and did not feel that this pacing was of any benefit to us as guests. on check-out we were charged 8% tax on top of our bill which was unexpected, the receptionist told us we could claim it back at the airport- we could not as the airport told us hotels were not included for tax reclaim (?!!) we need to investigate this further as it is not good if the reception staff are giving out incorrect information. We did not use any other of the hotel facilities... the food and drink looked particularly expensive, and the spa a little un-finished. I would reccommend this hotel when it is finished, and if the staff were a little more helpful and better trained.

Reviews.Title: “nice location in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Xatunga
Reviews.Content: my 3 days trip to istanbul was very good with my stay at this hotel, there was no review abouth the hotel but it has very good description and pictures on booking.com, price was reasonable thatiswhy we choose this hotel, we stayed in family suite and very comfortable. i advice this hotel to familiest with family suite, good service, ok breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Opened too early hotel not complete”
Reviews.Author: Cemuk
Reviews.Content: What a shame, such a fabulous hotel with great potential but greeted with no pool or spar with building work ongoing. Then no terrace bar restaurant just a breakfast area in the reception area. The the problems began, no hot water for showers several times. Heat in rooms 29c whereas 17c outside. Firstly told that on Istanbul all hotelsvturn air conditioning off then the whole hotel has a fault. Solution is to keep the windows open all night but very noisy area with other active building projects adjacent. In summary it will be excellent but opened too early with facilities sadly missing. So don't be sold by the fabulous pictures on the Internet as only the bedrooms ( saunas ) are there now.

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo Donizetti Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Asmalimescit Sk. No:85 | Beyoglu, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
